intro: Vachellia pennivenia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved acacia, is a shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, often spiny stems and bipinnate leaves that are reduced to small, scale-like structures. The plant produces yellow, globular flower heads that are typical of the Fabaceae family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Vachellia pennivenia is also known for its role in soil stabilization and as a source of browse for wildlife.
